p: At the time of this writing, current COVID-19 tests are either too slow, if they are reliable, or too unreliable, if they are not slow. To have any meaningful impact on the reproduction number R, current viral tests would have to be administered much more frequently and across a much larger share of the population—likely testing a majority of the population more than once per month—during a post-quarantine period at pre-pandemic levels of social distancing.
